meanings.sent1: Mom will chide you if you don't finish your homework on time.
meanings.sent2: It is not polite to chide others in public.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to chide the students for talking during the lesson.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to chide the leaves for falling too soon.
meanings.sent5: The coach's stern chide motivated the team to work harder.

meanings.sent1: She would often chide her brother for leaving his toys everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The boss didn't chide him directly but gave a subtle hint of disapproval.
meanings.sent3: The cat would chide the dog for stealing its bed.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to chide the sun for hiding behind them.
meanings.sent5: Her gentle chide made him realize his mistake and apologize.
